column3: a big problem these herbivorous fishes face when they eat algae. It is not easy to digest! Algae
column6: with each specialized for a certain role. The cells of algae hold complex
column10: unique composition of these large sugar chains within their cells. To get energy from algae
column11: herbivorous fishes need to break down these large chains. Inside the guts of fish are molecules known as enzymes (think of them as molecular or chemical scissors) that can break these sugar chains into smaller parts fish can absorb into their bodies. There are many different types of these enzymes
column12: functioning like different workers on a construction team. Each enzyme has a specific job in breaking down different parts of algae. However
column13: not all fish have the right kinds of enzymes to break down algae. So
column14: how are they able to get nutrients from algae that are hard to digest?
